page.title: 01KELVEDON AND FEERING
page.content: Kelvedon is a village in north-east Essex.The road to Coggeshall goes past the station and through Coggeshall Hamlet.Over the River{ {Blackwater}is Feering.The station is on the line from London to Norwich and lots of commuters go into London.There used to be a line to Tollesbury from Kelvedon.In Kelvedon there are quite a few antique shops and small supermarkets.There are also greengrocers and butchers.There is a small recreation ground in Feering.An old Roman track runs south from Easterford Mill.The village of Feering is not next to Kelvedon but up Feering Hill and to the north.There is a Post Office in both villages.The Fish and Chip shop is meant to be quite good.The slogan that the builders use is: "Kelvedon.Quite simply..a beautiful place to live."
